gold_definition: Machine learning (ML) is a subfield of soft computing within computer science that evolved from the study of pattern recognition and computational learning theory in artificial intelligence.
generated_definition: A computer program that learns to recognize and interpret text by analyzing its meaning and comparing it to previously known text .

gold_definition: In computer science and operations research, a genetic algorithm (GA) is a metaheuristic inspired by the process of natural selection that belongs to the larger class of evolutionary algorithms (EA).
generated_definition: A method of generating a random set of values using a set of rules .

gold_definition: A classification is a division or category in a system which divides things into groups or types.

gold_definition: Deep learning is a subfield of machine learning concerned with algorithms inspired by the structure and function of the brain called artificial neural networks.

gold_definition: Data mining is an interdisciplinary subfield of computer science and statistics with an overall goal to extract information (with intelligent methods) from a data set and transform the information into a comprehensible structure for further use.
generated_definition: The process of analyzing large amounts of data in order to make predictions .

gold_definition: Cloud computing is a general term for anything that involves delivering hosted services over the internet.

gold_definition: A support vector machine (SVM) is a supervised machine learning model that uses classification algorithms for two-group classification problems.

gold_definition: Clustering is the task of grouping a set of objects in such a way that objects in the same group (called a cluster) are more similar (in some sense) to each other than to those in other groups (clusters).
generated_definition: Clustering of related items .

gold_definition: In computer science, model checking or property checking is a method for checking whether a finite-state model of a system meets a given specification (also known as correctness).
generated_definition: A method of checking the accuracy of a computer model .

gold_definition: Computer security, cybersecurity or information technology security (IT security) is the protection of computer systems and networks from information disclosure, theft of or damage to their hardware, software, or electronic data, as well as from the disruption or misdirection of the services they provide.
generated_definition: A system for securing data .

gold_definition: Mathematical optimization (alternatively spelled optimisation) or mathematical programming is the selection of a best element, with regard to some criterion, from some set of available alternatives.

gold_definition: In machine learning and statistics, feature selection, also known as variable selection, attribute selection or variable subset selection, is the process of selecting a subset of relevant features (variables, predictors) for use in model construction.
